symptoms.name: Pain in neck, lumbosacral region, and limbs

vital_signs.heart_rate: 75/min (within normal range in one case, but elevated in another)

physical_findings: Localized tenderness in the lower abdomen
Limited activities of lumbar and cervical vertebrae

lab_values.CRP: Elevated (115.29 mg/L and 200 mg/L in different cases)

risk_factors: Underlying illnesses (liver cirrhosis, diabetes, hemochromatosis, thalassemia, malignancy, immune suppression)

imaging_findings.abdominal_CT: Marked wall thickening and mucosal hyper-enhancement in the terminal ileum, minimal intussusception at the ileocecal valve, multiple enlarged mesenteric lymph nodes
imaging_findings.ultrasound: Markedly increased liver echogenicity, mildly enlarged spleen
imaging_findings.colonofiberscopy: Hyperemic nodular edematous mucosa on the terminal ileum, hemorrhagic spots on the rest of the colon
imaging_findings.X-ray and CT: Double sacroiliac joint fusion (consistent with ankylosing spondylitis)

required: Isolation of Yersinia pseudotuberculosis or Yersinia enterocolitica from blood culture
supportive: Clinical symptoms consistent with extraintestinal yersiniosis (fever, abdominal pain, diarrhea, jaundice, etc.)
Imaging findings suggestive of intestinal or extraintestinal involvement
